Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chrysanthemum \Chrys*an"the*mum\, n. [L., fr. Gr. ?; chryso`s gold + ? flower.] (Bot.) A genus of composite plants, mostly perennial, and of many species including the many varieties of garden chrysanthemums (annual and perennial), and also the feverfew and the oxeye daisy. [1913 Webster]

chrysanthemum n 1: the flower of a chrysanthemum plant 2: any of numerous perennial Old World herbs having showy brightly colored flower heads of the genera Chrysanthemum; Argyranthemum; Dendranthema; Tanacetum; widely cultivated
